context_evidences: - He attended Arvada West High School from 2015 until he graduated in 2018, Jeffco Public Schools spokeswoman Cameron Bell confirmed Tuesday. He was on the wrestling team his junior and senior years. Reference: https://www.denverpost.com/2021/03/23/boulder-shooting-suspect-ahmad-al-aliwi-alissa/ published on 2021-03-23 17:05:29

- When he was a senior at Arvada West High School, Mr. Alissa was convicted in 2018 of misdemeanor assault against another student in a classroom, and told the police at the time that it was in retaliation for insults and ethnic taunts. Fellow students recall him as having a fierce temper that would flare in response to setbacks or slights. Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/03/23/us/boulder-colorado-shooting published on 2021-03-23 09:10:49

- Mr. Alissa’s brother described him to the Daily Beast as mentally ill, paranoid and antisocial. Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/03/23/us/boulder-colorado-shooting published on 2021-03-23 09:10:49

- Alissa lived with his family in an Arvada subdivision on West 65th Place, a quiet neighborhood of single-family homes. Neighbors said the household appeared to be multi-generational with a large number of family members living there. Reference: https://www.denverpost.com/2021/03/23/boulder-shooting-suspect-ahmad-al-aliwi-alissa/ published on 2021-03-23 17:05:29
correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. The suspected gunman in the Boulder, Colorado mass shooting is not a white guy, but a 21-year-old man named Ahmad Al Aliwi Alissa, who was born in Syria and lived most of his life in the United States. He was described as violent, short-tempered, and paranoid during high school. His brother described him as mentally ill, paranoid, and antisocial. 
https://www.denverpost.com/2021/03/23/boulder-shooting-suspect-ahmad-al-aliwi-alissa/
https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/03/23/us/boulder-colorado-shooting
note_1_text: The gunman, Ahmad Al Aliwi Alissa, had emigrated to the US from Raqqa, Syria.  https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/boulder-suspect-syrian-refugee/
note_2_text: The brother told CNN  that in high school bullies made fun of Alissa’s name and for being Muslim. The family emigrated from Syria in 2002. Family stated he is mentally ill. https://www.cnn.com/2021/03/23/us/boulder-colorado-shooting-suspect/index.html    Judge said he incompetent to stand trial. https://apnews.com/article/ahmad-al-aliwi-alissa-colorado-boulder-legal-proceedings-shootings-dcddc3437e0c3988ed942187c53c0faa    The claim of white supremacy is misinformation.

refute_evidences: - The 21-year-old Arvada man arrested in Monday’s mass shooting at a Boulder King Sooper’s was violent, short-tempered and paranoid during high school, his former classmates said Tuesday. Ahmad Al Aliwi Alissa is suspected of killing 10 people at the grocery store Monday when he walked in around 2:30 p.m. and began shooting, according to law enforcement. Reference: https://www.denverpost.com/2021/03/23/boulder-shooting-suspect-ahmad-al-aliwi-alissa/ published on 2021-03-23 17:05:29

- Court records show he was born in Syria in 1999, as did a Facebook page that appeared to belong to the suspect, giving his name as Ahmad Al Issa; the page was taken down within an hour of his name being released by the authorities. Michael Dougherty, the Boulder County district attorney, said the suspect had “lived most of his life in the United States.” Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/03/23/us/boulder-colorado-shooting published on 2021-03-23 09:10:49

- The gunman was armed with both a military-style semiautomatic rifle and a pistol when he walked into the King Soopers store on Monday and opened fire, officials said. They identified the suspect who was arrested at the scene as Ahmad Al Aliwi Alissa, who lived in Arvada , a nearby suburb; he was charged on Tuesday with 10 counts of first-degree murder, which in Colorado carries a penalty of life imprisonment without parole. Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/03/23/us/boulder-colorado-shooting published on 2021-03-23 09:10:49

- He would talk about him being Muslim and how if anybody tried anything, he would file a hate crime and say they were making it up,” Marvel said. “It was a crazy deal. I just know he was a pretty cool kid until something made him mad, and then whatever made him mad, he went over the edge — way too far.” Reference: https://www.denverpost.com/2021/03/23/boulder-shooting-suspect-ahmad-al-aliwi-alissa/ published on 2021-03-23 17:05:29
